div1.p: Gandy informs Flexner that a negative of one of Reed's photographs is broken. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

October 17, 1913.
Simon Flexner, M. D.,
Rockefeller Institute,
66th Street & Avenue A,
New York, N. Y.
My dear Doctor Flexner:-
div1.p:
With reference to your note of the 16th instant
on the subject of the photographs of Walter Reed I regret to inform you
(Write nothing in this space.)
(Attach this end)
that I have learned that the smaller negative has been broken, consequent-
ly only the larger picture has been sent you. Should you desire an ad-
ditional but smaller print it is believed that one can in due course of
time be made by reduction.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, CHAS. M. GANDY CMG
Acting Surgeon General, U. S. Army.
